org.javautil.sql
Class QueryHelper

java.lang.Object
  org.javautil.sql.QueryHelper
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.springframework.beans.factory.DisposableBean
public class QueryHelper
extends Object
implements org.springframework.beans.factory.DisposableBean

A helper for executing and binding jdbc statements. Supports bind of queries using case-insensitive bind variables prefixed by a colon. Allows for reuse of the same statement with subsequent binds. Implements DisposableBean for closing of sql statements. The code invoking this class is resposible for closing the ResultSets returned.

Author:
jjs@javautil.org, bcm

executeQuery

public ResultSet executeQuery(Map<String,Object> bindMap)
                       throws SQLException
Executes a query, adding the specified binds, and returning a ResultSet. If there are any missing binds, the query will fail. Remember to close the ResultSet!

Returns:
ResultSet
Throws:
SQLException

executeQuery

public ResultSet executeQuery(Map<String,Object> bindMap,
                              boolean setRemainingBindsToNull)
                       throws SQLException
Executes a query, adding the specified binds, and returning a ResultSet. If there are any missing binds, and setRemainingBindsToNull is false, the query will fail. If there are any missing binds, and setRemainingBindsToNull is true, the query will be executed with the unspecified binds set to null. Remember to close the ResultSet!

Returns:
ResultSet
Throws:
SQLException

destroy

public void destroy()
             throws SQLException
Required method for DisposableBean. It is good practice to call this method to close the SQL statement after a query has been executed. Alternatively, the methods returning a ResultSet can close the statement as well, by first calling ResultSet.getStatement().close().

Specified by:
destroy in interface org.springframework.beans.factory.DisposableBean
Throws:
SQLException

isAllowExtraBindVariables

public boolean isAllowExtraBindVariables()
Setter for allowExtraBindVariables. When false, bind variables that were not found in the query sql text will cause an error to be thrown.
